page.title: 02 Letterboxes
page.content: {Letterboxing}is an enjoyable free activity for people that like walking on{Dartmoor. A letterbox is a small hidden container for other people to find using a{six figure grid reference.}In the container there is a notepad, ink pad and a printing stamp.The stamp is for you to print in your pad.One example,which can be found on {Butterdon Hill}is{"Tony the Pony", which has a picture of a Dartmoor pony on the stamp.There are over five hundred to collect.When one hundred are collected you can send away and receive a{hundred club badge}and a book of clues.Before you have one hundred stamps you have to get clues from friends or other people you meet on the moors.
